Notes: Colombian informal price question - Very common in markets and shops, more natural than '¿Cuánto cuesta?' | INFORMAL | Example: 'A cómo está el kilo de banano?' (How much is a kilo of bananas?)
Challenge or encouragement - Can be playful or confrontational depending on tone | CASUAL/INFORMAL | Example: 'A ver si puedes llegar primero' (Let's see if you can arrive first)
Payment method question - Short for credit/debit card | NEUTRAL/FORMAL | Example: '¿Aceptan tarjeta o solo efectivo?' (Do you accept card or only cash?)

Back (EN): Do you accept transfer or Nequi?
Notes: Digital payment question - Nequi is Colombian digital wallet by Bancolombia | NEUTRAL | Example: '¿Aceptan transferencia o Nequi? No tengo efectivo' (Do you accept transfer or Nequi? I don't have cash)

Front (ES): Bájale un poquito a la música porfa
Back (EN): Can you turn the music down a little please?
Notes: Polite request to lower volume - 'Porfa' is casual shortening of 'por favor' | CASUAL/FRIENDLY | Example: 'Bájale un poquito a la música porfa, estoy en reunión' (Turn the music down a bit please, I'm in a meeting)
Standard price question - More formal than 'a cómo está' | NEUTRAL/FORMAL | Example: '¿Cuánto cuesta el pasaje a Cartagena?' (How much does the ticket to Cartagena cost?)
Quick price/total question - Often used when asking for the bill or total | NEUTRAL | Example: '¿Cuánto es todo junto?' (How much is everything together?)
Price question pointing at specific item - 'Vale' is commonly used instead of 'cuesta' | NEUTRAL | Example: '¿Cuánto vale este arroz de coco?' (How much is this coconut rice?)
Question about preferences - Common in restaurants, hair salons, etc. | CASUAL/NEUTRAL | Example: '¿Cómo lo quieres el jugo? ¿Con o sin azúcar?' (How do you want the juice? With or without sugar?)

Direct request for someone to state their desires - Can be casual or intimate depending on context | CASUAL/INFORMAL | Example: 'Dime qué quieres comer y lo pedimos' (Tell me what you want to eat and we'll order it)
Polite request to slow down speech - Essential for language learners | POLITE/CASUAL | Example: 'Háblame despacito porfa, todavía estoy aprendiendo' (Please speak slowly to me, I'm still learning)
Bill handling question at restaurants - Asking if you want one bill or separate bills | NEUTRAL/FORMAL | Example: 'La cuenta ¿junto o separado?' (The bill, together or separate?)
Restaurant request for the check - 'Porfa' makes it friendly and polite | CASUAL/POLITE | Example: 'La cuenta porfa cuando puedas' (The bill please when you can)

Back (EN): Can you help me with something?
Notes: Polite way to ask for help - Very common and friendly | POLITE/CASUAL | Example: '¿Me ayudas con algo? No entiendo esta dirección' (Can you help me with something? I don't understand this address)
Polite request to repeat information - Essential for language learners | POLITE/NEUTRAL | Example: '¿Me puedes repetir tu número de celular?' (Can you repeat your cell number?)

Back (EN): Can you give me a bag?
Notes: Polite request using 'regalar' - In Colombia 'regalar' is used for polite requests even when not actually a gift | POLITE/NEUTRAL | Example: '¿Me regalas una bolsa para estas compras?' (Can you give me a bag for these purchases?)
Casual polite request to repeat - 'Porfa' softens the request | CASUAL/POLITE | Example: 'No escuché bien, ¿me repites eso porfa?' (I didn't hear well, can you repeat that please?)
Restaurant seating request - Standard phrase when arriving | POLITE/NEUTRAL | Example: 'Buenas noches, mesa para dos porfa' (Good evening, table for two please)

Back (EN): Can you bring us water please?
Notes: Casual restaurant request - 'Porfa' is shortened 'por favor', very common in service contexts | CASUAL/POLITE | Example: '¿Nos trae agua porfa mientras miramos el menú?' (Can you bring us water please while we look at the menu?)
Request for another drink - Can substitute jugo/cerveza with any beverage | CASUAL/POLITE | Example: 'Este jugo está muy bueno, ¿otro jugo porfa?' (This juice is very good, another juice please?)

Restaurant request for shareable portions or plates - Common when ordering appetizers | CASUAL/POLITE | Example: '¿Nos trae unas arepas para compartir porfa?' (Can you bring us some arepas to share please?)
Takeout request - Specify you want food to take away | CASUAL/POLITE | Example: 'La empanada para llevar porfa' (The empanada to go please)
Request for introduction - Asking someone to introduce you to another person | CASUAL/POLITE | Example: 'Preséntame porfa a tu hermana' (Introduce me please to your sister)
Request to pass an object - Can substitute toalla with any object | CASUAL/POLITE | Example: '¿Pásame la toalla porfa? Está en el baño' (Pass me the towel please? It's in the bathroom)
Short offer question - Often followed by a noun or verb | CASUAL/INFORMAL | Example: '¿Quieres café?' (Do you want coffee?)

Front (ES): Quieres agua o algo de comer
Back (EN): Do you want water or something to eat?
Notes: Hospitality offer - Common when someone visits your home | FRIENDLY/CASUAL | Example: '¿Quieres agua o algo de comer? Tengo arepas' (Do you want water or something to eat? I have arepas)

Back (EN): Do you want water or a soft drink?
Notes: Drink offer - 'Algo suave' means non-alcoholic drink in Colombian Spanish | FRIENDLY/CASUAL | Example: '¿Quieres agua o algo suave? Tengo gaseosa' (Do you want water or a soft drink? I have soda)

Back (EN): Do you want to come in?
Notes: Invitation to enter - Polite offer to let someone come inside | POLITE/FRIENDLY | Example: '¿Quieres pasar? Hace mucho calor afuera' (Do you want to come in? It's very hot outside)

Back (EN): Do you want to go out with me?
Notes: Dating invitation - Can be romantic or friendly depending on context and tone | CASUAL/ROMANTIC | Example: '¿Quieres salir conmigo este fin de semana?' (Do you want to go out with me this weekend?)

Back (EN): Do you want to be my girlfriend?
Notes: Romantic relationship proposal - Direct way to ask someone to be your girlfriend | ROMANTIC/SERIOUS | Example: 'Me gustas mucho, ¿quieres ser mi novia?' (I like you a lot, do you want to be my girlfriend?)

Back (EN): What do you want to order?
Notes: Restaurant question - Asking what someone wants to order from the menu | CASUAL/NEUTRAL | Example: '¿Qué quieres pedir? Yo voy a pedir bandeja paisa' (What do you want to order? I'm going to order bandeja paisa)

Back (EN): What do you want to drink?
Notes: Beverage question - Asking what someone wants to drink | CASUAL/NEUTRAL | Example: '¿Qué quieres tomar? Tengo jugo de lulo' (What do you want to drink? I have lulo juice)

Front (ES): Si digo algo raro corrígeme porfa
Back (EN): If I say something weird correct me please
Notes: Language learner's request - Asking for corrections when speaking | POLITE/HUMBLE | Example: 'Si digo algo raro corrígeme porfa, estoy aprendiendo español' (If I say something weird correct me please, I'm learning Spanish)
Dietary preference request - Requesting no sugar in drinks | POLITE/CASUAL | Example: 'Un tinto sin azúcar porfa' (A coffee without sugar please)
Food preference request - Can substitute cebolla with any ingredient | POLITE/CASUAL | Example: 'La hamburguesa sin cebolla porfa' (The hamburger without onion please)
Payment method question - Asking if someone has physical money | NEUTRAL/CASUAL | Example: '¿Tienes efectivo? Aquí no aceptan tarjeta' (Do you have cash? They don't accept card here)

Back (EN): Drink some water and rest please
Notes: Caring suggestion - 'Agüita' is diminutive showing affection, used when someone is tired/sick | CARING/AFFECTIONATE | Example: 'Te ves cansado, toma agüita y descansa porfa' (You look tired, drink some water and rest please)
Polite request to wait - Asking for a brief moment | POLITE/CASUAL | Example: 'Un segundo porfa, ya termino esta llamada' (One second please, I'm finishing this call)
